title: Dick Padbury
text:
Richard Padbury (first ¼ 1886 – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> and <a href="Cheshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Cheshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Runcorn%20RFC">Runcorn RFC</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a> (prior to the specialist positions of; ), during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Dick Padbury's birth was registered in <a href="Runcorn">Runcorn</a> district, <a href="Cheshire">Cheshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Dick Padbury won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Runcorn RLFC in 1908 against Wales, and New Zealand, in 1909 against Wales, and in 1912 against Wales, and won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Runcorn RLFC playing as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 9, in the 6-5 victory over Australia during the <a href="1908%E2%80%9309%20Kangaroo%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain">1908–09 Kangaroo tour of Great Britain</a> at <a href="Villa%20Park">Villa Park</a> on 10 February 1909.
Club career.
Dick Padbury was considered a "Probable" for the <a href="1910%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1910 Great Britain Lions tour of Australia and New Zealand</a>, but ultimately he was not selected for the tour.
